qas.question: What has been Northwestern's official color since 1892?
Why did Northwestern replace it's original official colors of black and gold?

answers.text: too many other universities had used these colors

qas.question: What is the meaning of the Latin phrase on Northwestern's seal?
What does the Greek phrase that is inscribed on the pages of an open book on the seal mean?

answers.text: The Word full of grace and truth

qas.question: What color besides purple is often considered an official color of Northwestern?
What has been Northwestern's official color since 1822?
Why did Northwestern replace it's original official colors of yellow and gold?
What is the meaning of the French phrase on Northwestern's seal?

plausible_answers.text: The Word full of grace and truth

qas.question: What does the Greek phrase that is inscribed on the pages of an closed book on the seal mean?
What color besides blue is often considered an official color of Northwestern?

context: The Latin phrase on Northwestern's seal, Quaecumque sunt vera (<a2_0><b7_0>Whatsoever things are true<b7_0/><a2_0/>) is drawn from the Epistle of Paul to the Philippians 4:8, while the Greek phrase inscribed on the pages of an open book is taken from the Gospel of John 1:14: ο λόγος πλήρης χάριτος και αληθείας (<a3_0><b8_0>The Word full of grace and truth<b8_0/><a3_0/>). <a0_0><b5_0>Purple<b5_0/><a0_0/> became Northwestern's official color in 1892, replacing black and gold after a university committee concluded that <a1_0><b6_0>too many other universities<b6_0/> had used these colors<a1_0/>. Today, Northwestern's official color is purple, although <a4_0><b9_0>white<b9_0/><a4_0/> is something of an official color as well, being mentioned in both the university's earliest song, Alma Mater (1907) ("Hail to purple, hail to white") and in many university guidelines.
